result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Lee Fox

records.addlTxt: 3:13 PM Defendant Joshua Lee Fox appeared by video, in custody. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Joshua Lee Fox. Halyburton - proceed with PH. State calls Crandon Chief of Police Eric Bath. Bath sworn in at 3:14 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (3:17 PM). Attorney Halyburton has no questions. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed the Information. Halyburton has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for JT.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:47 AM Defendant Joshua Lee Fox in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Halyburton and Fox have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but will waive time limits for it. Court considers time limits waived, set for PH on 5/26/22 at 3:30 PM, continues bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:50 AM Defendant Joshua Lee Fox in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua Lee Fox appeared by video means from FOSO. Fox has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Fox understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, not working at this time. Court refers to SPD, contact them ASAP, reminds him of his right to court appointed attorney, set for AIA on 4/27/22 at 10:30 AM. State informs Court that the defendant has Attorney Hallyburton on his other matters. Court instructs to contact SPD to let them know about this case as well. State - bond - asks that Court continue bond. Court does have a letter from the defendant requesting a signature bond. Defendant makes statement, updates address. Court - bond - continues it at this point, will address again when attorney is present.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Lee Fox
Current: 3348 Indian Route 10, Crandon, WI 54520   (Effective: 04-20-2022)
Prior: 2799 Hwy 55, Crandon, WI 54520
Refused to sign. No consumption of alcohol
